newsitem.title: CANADA: CIBC cuts prime to 4.75 pct from 5.00 pct.
newsitem.headline: CIBC cuts prime to 4.75 pct from 5.00 pct.

text.p: Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce said on Friday it cut its prime lending rate to 4.75 percent from 5.00 percent, effective Tuesday.
The move follows a Bank of Canada rate cut of 25 basis points to 3.25 percent.
It matches identical moves by the Bank of Nova Scotia and Toronto-Dominion Bank.

Canada's major banks last changed their prime lending rates on October 29, when they lowered them to 5.00 percent from 5.25 percent. The prime rate is the rate charged by banks on loans to their best customers.
